Description: Upper body and rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with strongly everted rim; interior: lip glazed; wall reserved with one black band preserved; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with band between; glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer published the sherd twice under two different categories and identified it as coming from a Type 9A or Type 5C South Ionian cup or a Type 9B South Ionian cup. The profile of the sherd is closer to those of Type 9A and Type 5C cups. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup Type A2 or B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). However, the interior decoration is more consistent with Hayes' Rhodian Cup Type VIII. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are few at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. The number in Petrie's catalogue,183, is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 183)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 657, no. 144)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 49, no. 18; p. 51, no. 229)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.123) (Phase 3)
